latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Budget.

bill.title: Food and Drug Administration Safety Over Sequestration Act of 2013

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on the Budget.

item.name: Department of Health and Human Services

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Budget.

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: By Mr. LANCE:H.R. 2725.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 3[Page H4725]

item.text: Food and Drug Administration Safety Over Sequestration Act of 2013 - Amends the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 (Gramm-Rudman-Hollings Act) to exempt from sequestration calculations (mandatory across-the-board spending cuts) user fees that fund salaries and other administrative expenses of the Food and Drug Administration (FDA).
item.name: Introduced in House

item.title: Food and Drug Administration Safety Over Sequestration Act of 2013
To amend the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 to exempt from sequestration certain user fees of the Food and Drug Administration.
Food and Drug Administration Safety Over Sequestration Act of 2013

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
